entities.name: phineas
entities.description: Phineas is a person who receives a message from Professor McGonagall to deliver to someone else.

entities.name: arthur weasley
entities.description: Arthur Weasley is Harry's father and has been gravely injured in the course of his work for the Order of the Phoenix.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is a person who will be arriving at Arthur Weasley's house shortly after hearing about his father's injury.

entities.name: fred weasley
entities.description: Fred Weasley is one of the children of Arthur Weasley and Ginny Weasley.

entities.name: george weasley
entities.description: George Weasley is one of the children of Arthur Weasley and Ginny Weasley.

entities.name: ginny weasley
entities.description: Ginny Weasley is one of the children of Arthur Weasley and Harry Potter's friend.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is a person who informs Harry about his father's injury and brings Fred, George, and Ginny to the study.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a person who confirms Professor McGonagall's message about Arthur Weasley's injury.

relationships.description: Phineas receives the message from Professor McGonagall to deliver to someone else about Arthur Weasley's injury.
Professor McGonagall informs Phineas about the message to be delivered to someone else about Arthur Weasley's injury.
Dumbledore confirms Professor McGonagall's message about Arthur Weasley's injury to Harry Potter.
Professor McGonagall brings Fred, George, and Ginny to the study after informing them about Arthur Weasley's injury.
Professor McGonagall brings Fred, George, and Ginny to the study after informing them about Arthur Weasley's injury.
